message: “I was at a rap concert,” says Imus-Nahsonhoya, Hopi. “I was pacing back and forth waiting for somebody.” The man approached her and asked if she wanted a backstage pass to meet the celebrities. “‘You’ve got beautiful hair,’” he told me. ‘I just love your hair.’”

data.description: Valaura Imus-Nahsonhoya spoke to an attentive audience at Native Health of Phoenix in January about the time a “recruiter” attempted to lure her into being trafficked into prostitution.
data.title: Identifying, tracking and preventing human trafficking in Indian country
